Package controllers

Class ModifyProductController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controllers.ModifyProductController
  • public class ModifyProductController
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles interactions with the product form.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ModifyProductController

        public ModifyProductController()

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Called when the product form scene is loaded. Binds the data from the Inventory's list of parts and the current product's associated parts into the respective tables.

      • setMainWindowController

        public void setMainWindowController​(MainWindowController controller)
        Sets this class's reference to the mainWindowController.
        Parameters:
        controller - The application's mainWindowController.

      • setMainScene

        public void setMainScene​(javafx.scene.Scene scene)
        Sets this class's reference to the main scene.
        Parameters:
        scene - The application's main scene

      • setPrimaryStage

        public void setPrimaryStage​(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
        Sets this class's reference to the Application's primary stage
        Parameters:
        stage - The application's primary stage.

      • initializeNewProductForm

        public void initializeNewProductForm()
        Clears all data from the product form's text fields and sets the ID text field to the next available unique ID field. Also clears the partSearchTextField and leaves the part table unfiltered.

      • initializeModifyProductForm

        public void initializeModifyProductForm​(Product product)
        Sets the product form's text fields to hold the current product's data. Also populates the associated parts table with the product's associated parts.
        Parameters:
        product - The product being modified.

      • productFormSaveButtonListener

        private void productFormSaveButtonListener()
        Called when the save button is pressed. Will save the modified product or add a new product, as long as no input has invalid values; then return to the main scene. If there are invalid values, the productFormErrorLabel will be set to display the errors and the application stays on the product form.

      • productFormCancelButtonListener

        private void productFormCancelButtonListener()
        Called when the cancel button is pressed. Discards any changes to the product and returns to the main scene.

      • productFormAddAssociatedPartButtonListener

        private void productFormAddAssociatedPartButtonListener()
        Called when the add associated part button is pressed. If no part is selected, the function returns without performing any actions. If a part is selected, it is added to the associated part table.

      • productFormRemoveAssociatedPartButtonListener

        private void productFormRemoveAssociatedPartButtonListener()
        Called when the remove associated part button is pressed. If no part is selected, the function returns without performing any actions. If a part is selected, it is removed from the associated part table.

      • partSearchOnEnter

        public void partSearchOnEnter()
        Filters the parts shown in the part table based on the text in the partSearchTextField when the enter button is pressed while focused on the partSearchTextField.
